member.summary: Invokes the specified action on an subject so that you can chain it with any of the ShouldThrow or ShouldNotThrow overloads.

member.name: M:FluentAssertions.AssertionExtensions.ShouldBeEquivalentTo``1(``0,System.Object,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Asserts that an object is equivalent to another object.
member.remarks: Objects are equivalent when both object graphs have equally named properties with the same value, irrespective of the type of those objects. Two properties are also equal if one type can be converted to another and the result is equal. The type of a collection property is ignored as long as the collection implements and all items in the collection are structurally equal. Notice that actual behavior is determined by the instance of the class.
member.param: An optional formatted phrase as is supported by explaining why the assertion is needed. If the phrase does not start with the word because, it is prepended automatically.
Zero or more objects to format using the placeholders in .

member.name: M:FluentAssertions.AssertionExtensions.ShouldBeEquivalentTo``1(``0,System.Object,System.Func{FluentAssertions.Equivalency.EquivalencyAssertionOptions{``0},FluentAssertions.Equivalency.EquivalencyAssertionOptions{``0}},System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Asserts that an object is equivalent to another object.
member.remarks: Objects are equivalent when both object graphs have equally named properties with the same value, irrespective of the type of those objects. Two properties are also equal if one type can be converted to another and the result is equal. The type of a collection property is ignored as long as the collection implements and all items in the collection are structurally equal.
member.param: A reference to the configuration object that can be used to influence the way the object graphs are compared. You can also provide an alternative instance of the class.
An optional formatted phrase as is supported by explaining why the assertion is needed. If the phrase does not start with the word because, it is prepended automatically.
Zero or more objects to format using the placeholders in .

member.name: M:FluentAssertions.AssertionExtensions.As``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Safely casts the specified object to the type specified through .
member.remarks: Has been introduced to allow casting objects without breaking the fluent API.

member.name: M:FluentAssertions.AssertionExtensions.ShouldThrow``1(System.Action,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Asserts that the throws an exception.
member.param: A reference to the method or property.
member.typeparam: The type of the exception it should throw.
member.param: A formatted phrase explaining why the assertion should be satisfied. If the phrase does not start with the word because, it is prepended to the message.
Zero or more values to use for filling in any compatible placeholders.
member.returns: Returns an object that allows asserting additional members of the thrown exception.

member.name: M:FluentAssertions.AssertionExtensions.ShouldNotThrow``1(System.Action,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Asserts that the does not throw a particular exception.
member.param: The current method or property.
member.typeparam: The type of the exception it should not throw. Any other exceptions are ignored and will satisfy the assertion.
member.param: A formatted phrase explaining why the assertion should be satisfied. If the phrase does not start with the word because, it is prepended to the message.
Zero or more values to use for filling in any compatible placeholders.

Zero or more values to use for filling in any compatible placeholders.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the corresponding test framework is currently available.
